title: 98/210/EC: Commission Decision of 3 March 1998 concerning a request for exemption submitted by Italy pursuant to Article 8(2)(c) of Council Directive 70/156/EEC on the approximation of the laws of the Member States relating to the type-approval of motor vehicles and their trailers (Only the Italian text is authentic)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION of 3 March 1998 concerning a request for exemption submitted by Italy pursuant to Article 8(2)(c) of Council Directive 70/156/EEC on the approximation of the laws of the Member States relating to the type-approval of motor vehicles and their trailers (Only the Italian text is authentic) (98/210/EC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The request submitted by Italy for an exemption concerning two types of gas discharge lamp for two types of headlamp for one type of motor vehicle is hereby approved on condition that the vehicle type concerned is equipped with an automatic headlamp levelling system, a headlamp cleaning device and a system guaranteeing that dipped-beam headlamps are lit even if the main-beam headlamps are lit.
This Decision is addressed to the Italian Republic.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 3 March 1998.
For the Commission
Martin BANGEMANN
Member of the Commission
